titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: Bishop Bilbrough celebrated in the Cathedral at 8 a.m. Going and coming he walked beside me. The Bishop of Durham and about 40 clergy communicated. I attended the three addresses, and

listened with a genuine desire to understand what was really intended by this much–emphasized "National Mission of Religion & Hope"; but I learned nothing. The points on which particular stress was laid were just the old familiar exhausted shibboleths of the High Church Faction – daily service, Holy Communion as a substitute for Mattins, "definite Church Teaching", the failure of "undenominational" Christianity &c
